bill_title: prohibit an employer from requiring an employee or applicant to provide passwords to personal accounts.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit an employer from requiring an employee or applicant to provide passwords to personal accounts. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 60-11 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No employer may: (1) Require an employee or prospective employee to disclose a username, password, or other means of authentication for accessing a personal online account through an electronic communication device; (2) Require an employee or prospective employee to access a personal account in the presence of the employer in a manner that enables the employer to observe the contents of the personal account; (3) Take retaliatory personnel action that negatively affects the terms and conditions of employment against an employee due to the employee's refusal of the employer's request to provide a username, password, or other means of authentication for accessing a personal online account; (4) Refuse to hire a prospective employee solely as a result of the prospective employee's refusal of the prospective employer's request to provide a username, password, or other means of authentication for accessing a personal online account. Section 2. That chapter 60-11 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If an employer inadvertently obtains a username, password, or other means of authentication for accessing an employee's personal account, the employer is not liable for having the information. However, the employer may not use the information to access the employee's personal online account.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
